climbs.name: Neve Glacier / West Ridge
climbs.fa: William Degenhardt and Berbert Strandberg, August 1931

content.description: From the Colonial-Neve col, descend 300 feet to the Neve Glacier, then ascend to the Southeast edge at the base of the West Ridge.  Follow the broad ridge up to a gully on the climber's left.  Ascend the gully until just before its end, then climb up and over the climber's lefthand wall, down climbing to a ramp system.  Ascend the ramp system towards the summit, traversing to the climber's right about 50 feet below the summit into an open gully to reach the summit.
content.protection: A rope can be useful for some of the airy sections, especially if the route holds snow and verglas.
content.location: Begin the route at the base of the West Ridge.

pathTokens: Hwy 20 and North Cascades National Park
